title: Chat input: Add qml tests to cover the working functionality - Part 1
body:
### Description

We need qml tests that will cover the currently working functionality of StatusChatInput.qml.
This is a prerequisite of #8464 and #8465

The purpose of this task is to create the qml tests configuration for ui module and add chat input tests.
Nice to have: Reuse storybook models for the qml tests

Nice to have before we fix other chat input bugs:
#7686
#7685
Automatically closed by PR. Reopen as it's not finished

## Test scenarios

Text formatting scenarios from the notion page:
https://www.notion.so/3-Chat-and-Groups-b372835c9b464aba8a9a70ec8f51a14c#66e6330b98d84f088b1d5750cd772c96

### Testing keyboard input and navigation with plain text
```
Scenario: StatusChatInput initialisation
Given a new instance of StatusChatInput
When there is no keyboard input
Then the StatucChatInput raw text is empty
But the StatusChatInput is configured to support Rich Text
```
```
Scenario: StatusChatInput will display any typed Ascii visible character
Given a new instance of StatusChatInput
When the user is typing any Ascii visible character
Then the text is displayed as it is typed
And the input text is not modified by mentions processor
And the input text is not modified by emoji processor
```
```
Scenario: User can navigate in chat input using keyboard
Given the user has typed text on multiple lines in StatusChatInput
When the user hits key left, right, up, down
The cursor will move inside the text area to the left, right, up, down
```
```
Scenario: User can select text using keyboard
Given the user has typed text on multiple lines in StatusChatInput
When the user holds shift key
And hits key left, right, up, down
Then the selected text changes according to cursor navigation
```
```
Scenario: User can select all text in StatusChatInput
Given the user has typed text in StatusChatInput
When the user hits select all shortcut
Then all the text is selected
```
```
Scenario: User can cut text in StatusChatInput
Given user has selected all text in StatusChatInput
When the user hits cut shortcut
Then all selected text is removed
And his clipboard contains the initially selected text
```
```
Scenario: User can paste text in StatusChatInput
Given the user has copied text in clipboard
When the user hits paste shortcut
Then the text is displayed in the input field
And the input text is not modified by mentions processor
And the input text is not modified by emoji processor
```

### Testing keyboard input and navigation with mentions and emoji

```
Scenario: User can type text, mention and emoji
Given a new instance of StatusChatInput
And user has  <mention> as contact
When user is typing <text>
Then the text is displayed in the input field as <expectedText>
And the <mention> is inserted in the input field
And the <emoji> is inserted in the input field
And the <mention> can be replaced with contact public key

Examples:
text 						| mention 		                   	| expectedText
‚ÄúHello John:D‚Äù				|					| ‚ÄúHello John:D ‚Äú
‚ÄúHello @JohnDoe‚Äù				| @JohnDoe				| ‚ÄúHello @JohnDoe ‚Äù
‚ÄúHello:D@JohnDoe‚Äú  			| @JohnDoe				| ‚ÄúHello:D @JohnDoe ‚Äú 
‚Äú:DHello@JohnDoe‚Äù   			| @JohnDoe 				| ‚Äú:D Hello @JohnDoe ‚Äù 
‚Äú:D:D:D:D:D:D@JohnDoe:D:D:D‚Äù		| @JohnDoe				| ‚Äú:D :D :D :D :D :D @JohnDoe:D :D :D ‚Äù
‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1:D@JohnDoe2:D‚Äù	| @JohnDoe1 @JohnDoe2		| ‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1 :D @JohnDoe2 :D ‚Äù
‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1:D@JohnDoe2:D‚Äù	| 					| ‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1:D @JohnDoe2:D ‚Äù
```
```
Scenario: User can use keyboard to navigate text, emoji and mention
Given a new instance of StatusChatInput
And user has  <mention> as contact
And user has typed <text>
When the user is pressing left
Then the cursor moves to the left considering mention and emoji as single characters

Examples:
text 						| mention 		                   	| expectedText
‚ÄúHello John:D‚Äù				|					| ‚ÄúHello John:D ‚Äú
‚ÄúHello @JohnDoe‚Äù				| @JohnDoe				| ‚ÄúHello @JohnDoe ‚Äù
‚ÄúHello:D@JohnDoe‚Äú  			| @JohnDoe				| ‚ÄúHello:D @JohnDoe ‚Äú 
‚Äú:DHello@JohnDoe‚Äù   			| @JohnDoe 				| ‚Äú:D Hello @JohnDoe ‚Äù 
‚Äú:D:D:D:D:D:D@JohnDoe:D:D:D‚Äù		| @JohnDoe				| ‚Äú:D :D :D :D :D :D @JohnDoe:D :D :D ‚Äù
‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1:D@JohnDoe2:D‚Äù	| @JohnDoe1 @JohnDoe2		| ‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1 :D @JohnDoe2 :D ‚Äù
‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1:D@JohnDoe2:D‚Äù	| 					| ‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1:D @JohnDoe2:D ‚Äù
```
```
Scenario: User can use keyboard to select text, emoji and mention
Given a new instance of StatusChatInput
And user has <mention> as contact
And user has typed <text>
When the user is pressing shift key
And holds left key
Then the text is selected once the cursor moves left

Examples:
text 						| mention 		                   	| expectedText
‚ÄúHello John:D‚Äù				|					| ‚ÄúHello John:D ‚Äú
‚ÄúHello @JohnDoe‚Äù				| @JohnDoe				| ‚ÄúHello @JohnDoe ‚Äù
‚ÄúHello:D@JohnDoe‚Äú  			| @JohnDoe				| ‚ÄúHello:D @JohnDoe ‚Äú 
‚Äú:DHello@JohnDoe‚Äù   			| @JohnDoe 				| ‚Äú:D Hello @JohnDoe ‚Äù 
‚Äú:D:D:D:D:D:D@JohnDoe:D:D:D‚Äù		| @JohnDoe				| ‚Äú:D :D :D :D :D :D @JohnDoe:D :D :D ‚Äù
‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1:D@JohnDoe2:D‚Äù	| @JohnDoe1 @JohnDoe2		| ‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1 :D @JohnDoe2 :D ‚Äù
‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1:D@JohnDoe2:D‚Äù	| 					| ‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1:D @JohnDoe2:D ‚Äù
```
```
Scenario: User can use keyboard to delete text, emoji and mention
Given a new instance of StatusChatInput
And user has <mention> as contact
And user has typed <text>
When the user holds backspace key
Then the text is deleted as the cursor moves left

Examples:
text 						| mention 		                   	| expectedText
‚ÄúHello John:D‚Äù				|					| ‚ÄúHello John:D ‚Äú
‚ÄúHello @JohnDoe‚Äù				| @JohnDoe				| ‚ÄúHello @JohnDoe ‚Äù
‚ÄúHello:D@JohnDoe‚Äú  			| @JohnDoe				| ‚ÄúHello:D @JohnDoe ‚Äú 
‚Äú:DHello@JohnDoe‚Äù   			| @JohnDoe 				| ‚Äú:D Hello @JohnDoe ‚Äù 
‚Äú:D:D:D:D:D:D@JohnDoe:D:D:D‚Äù		| @JohnDoe				| ‚Äú:D :D :D :D :D :D @JohnDoe:D :D :D ‚Äù
‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1:D@JohnDoe2:D‚Äù	| @JohnDoe1 @JohnDoe2		| ‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1 :D @JohnDoe2 :D ‚Äù
‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1:D@JohnDoe2:D‚Äù	| 					| ‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1:D @JohnDoe2:D ‚Äù
```
```
Scenario: User can use keyboard to copy text, mention and emoji
Given user has <mention> as contact
And has typed <text>
And has selected entire <text>
When the user hits copy keyboard shortcut
Then the clipboard contains <expectedText>

Examples:
text 						| mention 		                   	| expectedText
‚ÄúHello John:D‚Äù				|					| ‚ÄúHello John:D ‚Äú
‚ÄúHello @JohnDoe‚Äù				| @JohnDoe				| ‚ÄúHello @JohnDoe ‚Äù
‚ÄúHello:D@JohnDoe‚Äú  			| @JohnDoe				| ‚ÄúHello:D @JohnDoe ‚Äú 
‚Äú:DHello@JohnDoe‚Äù   			| @JohnDoe 				| ‚Äú:D Hello @JohnDoe ‚Äù 
‚Äú:D:D:D:D:D:D@JohnDoe:D:D:D‚Äù		| @JohnDoe				| ‚Äú:D :D :D :D :D :D @JohnDoe:D :D :D ‚Äù
‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1:D@JohnDoe2:D‚Äù	| @JohnDoe1 @JohnDoe2		| ‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1 :D @JohnDoe2 :D ‚Äù
‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1:D@JohnDoe2:D‚Äù	| 					| ‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1:D @JohnDoe2:D ‚Äù
```
```
Scenario: User can use keyboard to cut text, mention and emoji
Given user has <mention> as contact
And has typed <text>
And has selected entire <text>
When user hits cut keyboard shortcut
Then the clipboard contains <expectedText>
And the text input is empty

Examples:
text 						| mention 		                   	| expectedText
‚ÄúHello John:D‚Äù				|					| ‚ÄúHello John:D ‚Äú
‚ÄúHello @JohnDoe‚Äù				| @JohnDoe				| ‚ÄúHello @JohnDoe ‚Äù
‚ÄúHello:D@JohnDoe‚Äú  			| @JohnDoe				| ‚ÄúHello:D @JohnDoe ‚Äú 
‚Äú:DHello@JohnDoe‚Äù   			| @JohnDoe 				| ‚Äú:D Hello @JohnDoe ‚Äù 
‚Äú:D:D:D:D:D:D@JohnDoe:D:D:D‚Äù		| @JohnDoe				| ‚Äú:D :D :D :D :D :D @JohnDoe:D :D :D ‚Äù
‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1:D@JohnDoe2:D‚Äù	| @JohnDoe1 @JohnDoe2		| ‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1 :D @JohnDoe2 :D ‚Äù
‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1:D@JohnDoe2:D‚Äù	| 					| ‚ÄúHello:@JohnDoe1:D @JohnDoe2:D ‚Äù
```
```
Scenario: User can use keyboard to paste text, mention and emoji
Given user has <mention> as contact
And has typed <text>
And has cut text to clipboard
When user hits paste keyboard shortcut
Then the text input has <expectedText>
And the <mention> is inserted in the input field
And the <emoji> is inserted in the input field
And the <mention> can be replaced with contact public key

Examples:
Text 						| mention 			| emoji
Hello John:D					|				| :D
Hello @JohnDoe				| @JohnDoe  		|
Hello:D@JohnDoe   			| @JohnDoe 			| :D
:DHello@JohnDoe   			| @JohnDoe 			| :D
:D:D:D:D:D:D@JohnDoe:D:D:D		|				| :D:D:D:D:D:D:D:D:D
Hello:@JohnDoe1:D@JohnDoe2:D	| @JohnDoe1 @JohnDoe2| :D
```
```
Scenario: Typing @ triggered mentions suggestions
Given a new instance of StatusChatInput
And user has "JohnDoe" as contact
When user is typing ‚Äú@‚Äù
Then mentions suggestions is opened
And JohnDoe is in the suggestions
```
```
Scenario: Mentions suggestions remain open
Given a new instance of StatusChatInput
And user has "JohnDoe" as contact
When user is typing ‚Äú@JohnDoe‚Äù
Then mentions suggestions is until the user finishes the input
And JohnDoe is in the suggestions
And after mentions suggestion closes the mention is inserted
```
```
Scenario: Typing <emoji> triggered emoji suggestions
Given a new instance of StatusChatInput
When user is typing <emoji>
Then <emoji> suggestions is opened
And and the emoji is in suggestions before hitting emoji end char ‚Äú:‚Äù
```
```
Scenario: User can type all emoji supported
Given a new instance of StatusChatInput
When user is typing <emoji>
Then the emoji is inserted in the text input
And the emoji can be converted to unicode
```

### Testing mouse input and navigation
```
Scenario: User can move cursor by mouse click
```
```
Scenario: User can select word with double click
```
```
Scenario: User can select emoji with double click
```
```
Scenario: User can select mention with double click
```
```
Scenario: User can trigger text format modifiers popup by selecting text
```
```
Scenario: User can select mention from mention suggestions
```
```
Scenario: User can select emoji from emoji suggestions
```

I would expect that further, detailed cases will come from bug reports. The case should be first covered with tests and then fixed. Once again, good job!

@noeliaSD Thanks! Will update the scenarios. This is what I test in StatusChatInput initialisation scenario:
```
Then the StatusChatInput raw text is empty 
-> Here we check that all APIs that are supposed to return plain text will return empty string
But the StatusChatInput is configured to support Rich Text 
-> But all the APIs that are supposed to return HTML text will return HTML and also the TextArea.textFormat is TextArea.RichText
```

@caybro I don't know yet the details of image paste, but will look into it and add a few scenarios. It's sure something to add on the list üëç. 
And the basic keyboard shortcuts are definitely something to consider, but I know some are not supported/buggy. Will add scenarios on the ones that are working. Thanks!

Hey, looks good. Just a couple of notes, the scenarios will be better if they are specific about what is happening. For example, `When the user is typing any Ascii visible character` and `Given the user has typed text in StatusChatInput` don't describe specific text input which leaves some ambiguity.

Similarly, it's clearer when each step only performs one action. `When the user hits key left, right, up, down` can be split into 4 examples or multiple when/then steps (less preferred option but might reduce test time in some cases).

```
Scenario outline: User can navigate in chat input using keyboard
Given the user has typed text on multiple lines in StatusChatInput
"""
the multiline text input could 
be passed from here
"""
When the user hits <direction>
The cursor will move inside the text area to the <direction>

Examples:
|direction|
|left|
|right|
|up|
|down|

When the user hits "left"
The cursor will move inside the text area to the "left"
When the user hits "right"
The cursor will move inside the text area to the "right"
```
